intro.description: Learn how to create your first SysML diagram. This cheat sheet will guide you through the creation of a SysML diagram.

subitem.label: In the 'Model Explorer' view, select a SysML project. If no project exists have a look to the corresponding tutorial 'Create a new project'.
Right-click on the project and select 'Create Representation'
In the wizard, expand 'SysML', select 'Block Definition Diagram' and then 'Next'.
On the next page, select 'Model' as semantic element to which the diagram will be attached. In our example the new block definition diagram will be attached to the root element of the UML model.

item.title: Set the name of the representation
item.description: Give a name to the new block definition diagram.

item.title: New block definition diagram is opened
item.description: A new block definition diagram editor is opened, you can use the tools in the palette to create new elements. Have a look to the SysML Designer User Guide for more detailed information on tools.
